title: Going Out for a Walk - rhetorical strategies

content.question: Which of the following rhetorical strategies does the author employ in the second paragraph (“He is saying . . . reading out the inscriptions”) ?

choices.label: He makes a potent allusion to demonstrate the breadth of his knowledge.
He presents credible evidence to forestall any potential objections from the reader.
He repeats the structure of an earlier conversation to underscore his main argument.
He mounts a personal attack on the fellow-guest to discredit his actions.

content.answer: He repeats the structure of an earlier conversation to underscore his main argument.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how the organization of a text creates unity and coherence and reflects a line of reasoning.
